title: Zyra has the worst passive and here is why
body:
{{champion:143}}  .  .  .
Zyra is a great champ, don't get me wrong, but...she has the worst passive in the game....

{{champion:96}} {{champion:30}} {{champion:14}} _all have passive similar to zyra's but much better_.
**karthus** can use** all** his abilities upon death.
**Sion** can do massive damage and still take farm/ towers and even champions upon death.
Let's take a closer look at kogmaw's passive ......
**kogmaw's passive is a near identical copy of zyra's except her's is a skill-shot and much more unreliable.**

{{champion:96}}  passive deals a max of **550** true damage at max level.  (aoe)***
NOTE: this is NOT a hard to use passive, just run to where the enemy is unless they use a mobility spell...Well thats too bad.   {{champion:32}} 
Zyra's passive deals** 440 **true damage. **NOTE, THIS IS A SKILL-SHOT!!! **
why does zyra's passive deal less damage than kogmaw's even though it is a harder ability to use.
both passives can deal aoe damage, why does zyra's deal less at a much higher dificulty.



I can see what some of your answers will be...
"_Well it only takes roughly 2 seconds for zyra to fire her passive, whereas it takes kogmaw 4 seconds_"
My answer: zyra has to take the time to track the enemy champions movement pattern if they are trying to dodge it, plus they can allways use {{summoner:4}} 
both passives also have about the same range as well, Kogmaw has higher dmg

**SOOO... in the end can somebody explain why Zyra has such a horrible passive?
A passive only proq'd upon death?
on a champ that needs good positioning?
If i made any mistakes feel free to correct me, thanks for reading!**  {{champion:18}}

replies.body: So true, although Zyra's passive isn't the best Zilean's by far is the worst.  It is the only passive in the game that can actually reach a point of complete uselessness.  Once you hit 18 Zilean has no passive. (on a side note, I'm happy to see the Zilean buff on PBE)
Draven's is useless at full build. L2P
Draven's has a useful impact when used.  L2P

Zilean's is there to win lane.  It guarantees you hit your levelups sooner than your lane opponents, which is really good, especially in bot lane.  Zyra's passive is unreliable at every stage of the game, isn't used if you don't die, and scales only with level.
Mord is better for that.
So is syndra's ult?

Actually, she has a passive it just doesn't activate until you max out an ability.  So that extra damage her Q gets is a pretty good passive in my opinion.  Not to mention the bonuses to W and E.  So at level 18 she is gaining quite a bit form her passive.
{{champion:110}} is probably a runner up

Zilean's Passive *was* useful.
Once.

This is what we call ''Power Budget''.


Her passive is meant to be shitty because the rest of her kit is incredibly strong.
...but is the rest of her kit strong?
Yes

Meanwhile someone like yasuo thresh or lee with insanely overloaded kits and useful passives... Zyra deserves SOMETHING I think! Ever compared just to other mages, all other mages have real passives that are useful in some way. Zyra's passive is insanely easy to dodge and the only time you really get kills with it is when you die first in a teamfight or when your enemy completely forgets you even HAVE a passive.

You think Zyra isn't overloaded? She has very hard to dodge burst damage, high sustained damage from her plants forming an effective zoning tool, long range CC which is at least easy to dodge, and a very large AoE nuke/CC tool. She is a very powerful defensive champion with the ability to poke with a low cooldown, low counterplay spell. If she wasn't immobile, squishy, and a passive only useful when she's losing, she'd be stupidly overpowered.

actually it's just the opposite, most of her damage is relatively easy to dodge which is why people always say shes a disengage or counter engage support. Its kinda like how alot of low cc/mobility jungelers are great counter-gankers but not very good at initiating ganks.

I don't remember when, but someone else made a post about Zyra's passive.  I agree with the both of you that it's weak, but they had a really cool buff/passive rework idea to make it better: If Zyra kills the enemy with her passive, the shot keeps flying and roots at the end of its path.  After 1.5 seconds, Zyra regrows from the shot with hp equal to the enemy she killed's hp upon being hit and going on a CD so she can't use her passive for x amount of time.  (I.E.:  If you hit someone with 233 hp for 440 true damage, you come back with 233 hp and you passive goes on CD).  I think this would be pretty cool, and if she fails to kill, her passive doesn't go on CD.

> [{quoted}](name=Rundus1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=FGaEEiTz,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-09-08T23:29:55.667+0000)

After 1.5 seconds, Zyra regrows from the shot with hp equal to the enemy she killed's hp upon being hit and going on a CD so she can't use her passive for x amount of time.  (I.E.:  If you hit someone with 233 hp for 440 true damage, you come back with 233 hp and you passive goes on CD).  I think this would be pretty cool, and if she fails to kill, her passive doesn't go on CD.

Like I say to everyone who thinks this is a really cool "buff" to Zyra's passive, it isn't. Her passive will still be terrible because you will rarely ever kill anyone with it. Maybe get a kill with it once per game, if even that? It simply does too little damage and is too hard to land for this kind of change to be meaningful.

While it might not be the most meaningful, it's still a buff and a good place to start.  Since it literally only gives her more power, it's a buff.  At the same time, more work could be done, but this would make her passive much more unique.  Simply put, she'd be able to get dove on, ult/root the diver in her team, and even if she dies she just has to last hit (or maybe even just hit them and they die within x amount of time) and she's back and ready to keep casting.  Being as backline as she is, a mechanic for controlling where the seed lands might be needed, but since Zyra as a whole isn't all that terribly weak, she shouldn't expect too much in the buff department.  And if the passive doesn't do enough damage, add variables to increase it.  Maybe she sucks the life from nearby plants, gaining +15% damage on passive hit per plant or something.  I could totally see that being helpful.  Either way, she doesn't need too much more power, it's mainly just her passive that sucks, and that would make it not suck so much.  It'd already outclass Zac's in most cases where the enemy just murders his blobs, Zyra can deal damage and still have a chance at coming back.  Plus, I'd argue that worst passive in the game would possibly be Taric's.  It'd be good with a few tweaks, but on its own it rarely accomplishes much of anything.

Well 100 - 440 true damage per shot that can pass through units and doesn't diminish in strength after passing through units seems like a bit much. That's a lot of potential true damage that her current power budget doesn't really take into consideration.
I feel like if that's the direction Riot took with her then the true damage per shot would have to be nerfed pretty hard. That way she would be rewarded for strategic placement of her plants and still have the potential to do more damage than she can on live with her current passive. Maybe something like 50 - 220 true damage per shot. That way if she has no plants up when she dies she is punished; she breaks even in terms of potential damage if she dies with a single active plant; and she has even more potential damage with two or more plants up if she dies.
I do however think that's the wrong direction to go. Zyra's  plants are supposed to be an integral part of her kit -  I think they need to be more impactful while she's alive to justify being there in the fist place. 
Just my two cents.
